content: knit will be square or rectangular either shape will work but i was going for squares in my sample start at outer border cast on 145 stitches row 1 through 19 or for 2 5 inches * k1 p1 repeat from * across to last stitch k1 seed stitch ideally you want the depth of the outermost border to be even all the way around the outside of the piece the border on the sides of the piece is created by reserving 13 stitches on each side as you knit you can measure the width of the 13 stitches at the edge of the piece and use that to guide or adjust the length of the lower border start inner border row 20 ws * k1 p1 repeat from * 5 more times k1 that s the 13 stitch outside border pm p59 p1 in front and back of next stitch to increase by 1 stitch p59 pm * k1 p1 repeat from * 5 times k1 the 13 stitches on other side of border = 146 stitches row 21 rs * k1 p1 repeat from * 5 more times k1 slip marker sm k120 sm ** k1 p1 repeat from ** 5 more times k1 row 22 ws * k1 p1 repeat from * 5 more times k1 slip marker sm p120 sm ** k1 p1 repeat from ** 5 more times k1 repeat row 21-22 4 more times repeat row 21 one more time for 12 total row of the inner border the width of the inner border will be maintained with 9 stitches on each side of the quilt panel as you go forward so as above check your width for 9 stitches and make any adjustments you need to the number of times you repeat row 21 and 22 to keep the inner border as even as possible all the way around the piece end with a right-side row start quilt block row q1 ws * k1 p1 repeat from * 5 more times k1 slip marker sm p9 k1 pm k100 pm k1 p9 sm ** k1 p1 repeat from ** 5 more times k1 this row creates an outline for the bottom of the quilt panel first row of blocks row q2 rs * k1 p1 repeat from * 5 more times k1 slip marker sm k9 p1 place or slip marker p20 ** k20 p20 repeat from ** once for 5 blocks place or slip marker p1 k9 sm *** k1 p1 repeat from *** 5 more times k1 row q3 ws * k1 p1 repeat from * 5 more times k1 sm p9 k1 sm k20 ** p20 k20 repeat from ** once sm k1 p9 sm *** k1 p1 repeat from *** 5 more times k1 work row q2 and q3 another 10 times for a total of 22 row to make a square end with a q3 wrong-side row this creates the first row of blocks in the quilt panel
